revised_title: High-Pressure Gas Viscosity Measurements: Nitrogen up to 1000 Atmospheres
tldr: This article describes a method for measuring the viscosity of gases at high pressures, specifically nitrogen up to 1000 atmospheres. The authors developed a transpiration method using a glass capillary and mercury to measure the mass of gas flowing through the capillary under a pressure gradient. The results provide insights into the behavior of gases under high pressure and their viscosity-density relationships.
